rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.STUDYID

classVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
classVariables.label: Study Identifier
classVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.DOMAIN

classVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation. The Domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.
classVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
classVariables.name: DOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.USUBJID

classVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
classVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
classVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.APID

classVariables.description: Identifier for a single associated person, a group of associated persons, or a pool of associated persons. If APID identifies a pool, POOLDEF records must exist for each associated person. (See Section 4.1.3, Pool Definition Dataset and Section 5, Applying Model Fundamentals to Associated Persons).
classVariables.label: Associated Persons Identifier
classVariables.name: APID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.POOLID

classVariables.description: An identifier used to identify a result from a group of subjects that is not assignable to a specific subject.
classVariables.label: Pool Identifier
classVariables.name: POOLID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.SPDEVID

classVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device.
classVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
classVariables.name: SPDEVID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.NHOID

classVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by the lab. Example: "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)".
classVariables.label: Non-Host Organism Identifier
classVariables.name: NHOID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.FETUSID

classVariables.description: Identifier used to identify a fetus from a maternal subject for prenatal evaluations. FETUSID uniquely identifies a fetus within a subject. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Fetus Identifier
classVariables.name: FETUSID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.FOCID

classVariables.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site, e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1", or a more specific focus, e.g., "OD" (right eye) or "Upper left quadrant of the back". The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.
classVariables.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
classVariables.name: FOCID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SEQ

classVariables.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
classVariables.label: Sequence Number
classVariables.name: --SEQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--GRPID

classVariables.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Also used to link together a block of related records in the Trial Summary dataset (see Section 3.3, Trial Summary Information).
classVariables.label: Group ID
classVariables.name: --GRPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--REFID

classVariables.description: Optional internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID, or UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
classVariables.label: Reference ID
classVariables.name: --REFID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RECID

classVariables.description: Identifier for a record that is unique within a domain for a study and that remains invariant through subsequent versions of the dataset, even if the content of the record is modified. When a record is deleted, this value must not be reused to identify another record in either the current or future versions of the domain.
classVariables.label: Invariant Record Identifier
classVariables.name: --RECID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SPID

classVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: pre-printed line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.
classVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
classVariables.name: --SPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKID

classVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For Example: A single tumor may have multiple measurements/assessments performed at each study visit.
classVariables.label: Link ID
classVariables.name: --LNKID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKGRP

classVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. For example: Multiple tumor measurements/assessments will contribute to a single response to therapy determination record.
classVariables.label: Link Group ID
classVariables.name: --LNKGRP

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISITNUM

classVariables.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
classVariables.label: Visit Number
classVariables.name: VISITNUM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISIT

classVariables.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
classVariables.label: Visit Name
classVariables.name: VISIT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISITDY

classVariables.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
classVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
classVariables.name: VISITDY

priorVersion.title: Planned Order of Element within Arm

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.TAETORD

self.title: Planned Order of Element within Arm

classVariables.description: Number that gives the planned order of the Element within the Arm (see Section 3.1.2, Trial Arms).
classVariables.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
classVariables.name: TAETORD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.EPOCH

classVariables.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected (see Section 3.1.2, Trial Arms).
classVariables.label: Epoch
classVariables.name: EPOCH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPHASE

classVariables.description: Reproductive Phase with which the Reproductive Stage of the Reproductive Path is associated. Defined in Trial Paths domain. The RPHASE variable is Required when any Reproductive Phase Day variable is used. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Repro Phase
classVariables.name: RPHASE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Observation

classVariables.description: The planned day within the Reproductive Phase on which the observation was scheduled to occur. Expressed as an integer. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Observation
classVariables.name: RPPLDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLSTDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

classVariables.description: The planned day within the Reproductive Phase of the start of the observation. Expressed as an integer. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs Start
classVariables.name: RPPLSTDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLENDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs End

classVariables.description: The planned day within the Reproductive Phase of the end of the observation. Expressed as an integer. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs End
classVariables.name: RPPLENDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DTC

classVariables.description: Collection date and time of an observation.
classVariables.label: Date/Time of Collection
classVariables.name: --DTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STDTC

classVariables.description: Start date/time of an observation.
classVariables.label: Start Date/Time of Observation
classVariables.name: --STDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENDTC

classVariables.description: End date/time of the observation.
classVariables.label: End Date/Time of Observation
classVariables.name: --ENDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DY

classVariables.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
classVariables.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
classVariables.name: --DY

priorVersion.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STDY

self.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

classVariables.description: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
classVariables.label: Study Day of Start of Observation
classVariables.name: --STDY

priorVersion.title: Study Day of End of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Observation

classVariables.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
classVariables.label: Study Day of End of Observation
classVariables.name: --ENDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--NOMDY

classVariables.description: The nominal study day used by data-collection and reporting systems for grouping records for observations that may be scheduled to occur on different days into a single study day (such as for output on a tabulation report). Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
classVariables.name: --NOMDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--NOMLBL

classVariables.description: A label for a given value of --NOMDY, within a domain, as presented in the study report. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
classVariables.name: --NOMLBL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Observation

classVariables.description: The actual day within the Reproductive Phase on which the observation occurred. Expressed as an integer. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Observation
classVariables.name: --RPDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPSTDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

classVariables.description: The actual day within the Reproductive Phase of the start of the observation. Expressed as an integer. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs Start
classVariables.name: --RPSTDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPENDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs End

classVariables.description: The actual day within the Reproductive Phase of the end of the observation. Expressed as an integer. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs End
classVariables.name: --RPENDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DUR

classVariables.description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.
classVariables.label: Duration
classVariables.name: --DUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPT

classVariables.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See --TPTNUM and --TPTREF.
classVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
classVariables.name: --TPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPTNUM

classVariables.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
classVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
classVariables.name: --TPTNUM

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

classVariables.description: Planned Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (--TPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval.
classVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
classVariables.name: --ELTM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPTREF

classVariables.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
classVariables.label: Time Point Reference
classVariables.name: --TPTREF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RFTDTC

classVariables.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF.
classVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --RFTDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STRF

classVariables.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before, during, or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.
classVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
classVariables.name: --STRF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENRF

classVariables.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before, during or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.
classVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
classVariables.name: --ENRF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--EVLINT

classVariables.description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding --TESTCD. Example: -P2M to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval for a question from a questionnaire.
classVariables.label: Evaluation Interval
classVariables.name: --EVLINT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--EVINTX

classVariables.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: LIFETIME, LAST NIGHT, RECENTLY, OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS.
classVariables.label: Evaluation Interval Text
classVariables.name: --EVINTX

priorVersion.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STRTPT

self.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

classVariables.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.
classVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --STRTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STTPT

classVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
classVariables.label: Start Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --STTPT

priorVersion.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENRTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

classVariables.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --ENTPT.
classVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --ENRTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENTPT

classVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
classVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --ENTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.MIDS

classVariables.description: The name of a specific instance of a Disease Milestone Type (MIDSTYPE) described in the Trial Disease Milestones dataset (see Section 3.5, Trial Disease Milestones). This should be unique within a subject. Used only in conjunction with RELMIDS and MIDSDTC.
classVariables.label: Disease Milestone Instance Name
classVariables.name: MIDS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RELMIDS

classVariables.description: The temporal relationship of the observation to the Disease Milestone Instance Name in MIDS. Examples: IMMEDIATELY BEFORE, AT TIME OF, AFTER.
classVariables.label: Temporal Relation to Milestone Instance
classVariables.name: RELMIDS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.MIDSDTC

classVariables.description: The start date/time of the Disease Milestone Instance Name in MIDS.
classVariables.label: Disease Milestone Instance Date/Time
classVariables.name: MIDSDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STINT

classVariables.description: The start of a planned evaluation or assessment interval relative to the Time Point Reference (--TPTREF).
classVariables.label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
classVariables.name: --STINT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENINT

classVariables.description: The end of a planned evaluation or assessment interval relative to the Time Point Reference (--TPTREF).
classVariables.label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
classVariables.name: --ENINT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DETECT

classVariables.description: The number of days from the start of dosing to the earliest detection of a condition or pathogen. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Time in Days to Detection
classVariables.name: --DETECT

description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings.  Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v1.6, Section 2.2)
label: General Observation Class
name: General Observations
